meanings.definition: Alongside the shore; parallel to the coast.
meanings.sent1: The boat sailed longshore, never straying far from the safety of the land.
meanings.sent2: The ship docked longshore, allowing easy access to the port.
meanings.sent3: The seagull flew longshore, keeping a watchful eye on the fishermen below.
meanings.sent4: The clouds moved longshore, casting shadows over the sandy beach.
meanings.sent5: The waves crashed longshore, creating a soothing rhythm along the coast.

meanings.definition: A person who works on or near the shore, especially in loading and unloading ships.
meanings.sent1: The longshore helped unload the cargo from the ship.
meanings.sent2: The longshore waved to the sailors as they departed.
meanings.sent3: The longshore joked with the captain while waiting for the next shipment.
meanings.sent4: The longshore's hands were calloused from years of hard work.
meanings.sent5: The longshore greeted each arriving vessel with a smile.

meanings.sent1: He decided to longshore to earn a living by the sea.
meanings.sent2: She longshores every summer to save up for college.
meanings.sent3: They longshore together, sharing stories of the ocean's mysteries.
meanings.sent4: The crew longshored tirelessly to meet the deadline.
meanings.sent5: I longshore with pride, knowing my hard work supports the maritime industry.
